Pynance: A Financial Optimization Application¶

This is a financial application that calculates asset correlations, statistics and optimal portfolio allocations using data it retrieves from external services (currently: AlphaVantage, IEX and Quandl). Statistics are calculated using Ito Calculus and should be consistent with the results demanded by Modern Portfolio Theory and Financial Engineering. The portfolios are optimized by minimizing the portfolio’s variance/volatility, i.e. by finding the optimal spot on the portfolio’s efficient frontier as defined by the CAPM model, or alternatively, by maximizing the portfolio’s Sharpe ratio.

The program’s functions are wrapped in PyQt5 widgets which provide a user interface. In addition, visualizations are created by matplotlib for easier presentation.

The program’s functions can also be wired into a WSGI Application using the Django framework provided in the /server/ directory. See WSGI Application for more information. The WSGI application can be containerized using the Dockerfile in the project root and deployed as a microservice. An Angular frontend can be built and served up through an nginx container to provide a user interface for the backend service. See WSGI Container and Frontend for more information.

See Setup for more information setting the application for the first time. See Environment for more information on configuration options. See Examples for example usage of the application.
